headline: Google, Accel partner to back Indian AI startups
summary: BENGALURU (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google and venture capital firm Accel will partner to fund at least 10 early-stage ​Indian AI startups, marking the U.S. technology giant's first such ‌funding partnership, top executives at the companies said on Thursday.  Under the partnership, Google's AI Futures Fund and Accel will co-invest up to $2 million in each startup, Prayank ⁠Swaroop, partner at Accel, ‌told Reuters in an interview, with the investments focussed on the wide areas of entertainment, creativity, work and coding.  The announcement comes after Google ‍in October said it would invest $15 billion over five years to set up an AI data centre in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, its biggest-ever investment in the country.

content.title: Google, Accel partner to back Indian AI startups
content.summary: BENGALURU (Reuters) -Alphabet's Google and venture capital firm Accel will partner to fund at least 10 early-stage ​Indian AI startups, marking the U.S. technology giant's first such ‌funding partnership, top executives at the companies said on Thursday.  Under the partnership, Google's AI Futures Fund and Accel will co-invest up to $2 million in each startup, Prayank ⁠Swaroop, partner at Accel, ‌told Reuters in an interview, with the investments focussed on the wide areas of entertainment, creativity, work and coding.  The announcement comes after Google ‍in October said it would invest $15 billion over five years to set up an AI data centre in the southern Indian state of Andhra Pradesh, its biggest-ever investment in the country.

thumbnail.caption: FILE PHOTO: On tiny Christmas Island, Google spurs renewable energy push for Indian Ocean data hub

headline: Amazon pushes in-house AI coding tool Kiro over competitors', memo shows
summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Amazon suggested its engineers eschew AI code generation tools from third-party companies in favor of its own, a move to bolster its ​proprietary Kiro service, which it released in July, according to an internal memo viewed ‌by Reuters.  In the memo, posted to Amazon's internal news site, the company said, "While we continue to support existing ‌tools in use today, we do not plan to support additional third party, AI development tools."  The guidance would seem to preclude Amazon employees from using ⁠other popular software coding tools like OpenAI'‌s Codex, Anthropic's Claude Code, and those from startup Cursor.

content.title: Amazon pushes in-house AI coding tool Kiro over competitors', memo shows
content.summary: SAN FRANCISCO (Reuters) -Amazon suggested its engineers eschew AI code generation tools from third-party companies in favor of its own, a move to bolster its ​proprietary Kiro service, which it released in July, according to an internal memo viewed ‌by Reuters.  In the memo, posted to Amazon's internal news site, the company said, "While we continue to support existing ‌tools in use today, we do not plan to support additional third party, AI development tools."  The guidance would seem to preclude Amazon employees from using ⁠other popular software coding tools like OpenAI'‌s Codex, Anthropic's Claude Code, and those from startup Cursor.

headline: Panasonic Energy to Supply Lithium-ion Batteries for Zoox, Marking a Milestone in Panasonic Energy's Entry into the Fast-growing Robotaxi Market
summary: Panasonic Energy Co., Ltd., a Panasonic Group Company, today announced it has signed an agreement with Zoox, the Amazon-owned autonomous ride-hailing company, to supply cylindrical lithium-ion battery cells to power its robotaxi fleet deployments. Under the multi-year agreement, Panasonic Energy will deliver its latest 2170 battery cells beginning in early 2026 to support Zoox's growing robotaxi service and operations.

content.title: Panasonic Energy to Supply Lithium-ion Batteries for Zoox, Marking a Milestone in Panasonic Energy's Entry into the Fast-growing Robotaxi Market
content.summary: Panasonic Energy Co., Ltd., a Panasonic Group Company, today announced it has signed an agreement with Zoox, the Amazon-owned autonomous ride-hailing company, to supply cylindrical lithium-ion battery cells to power its robotaxi fleet deployments. Under the multi-year agreement, Panasonic Energy will deliver its latest 2170 battery cells beginning in early 2026 to support Zoox's growing robotaxi service and operations.

thumbnail.caption: Panasonic Energy will begin supplying 2170 cylindrical lithium-ion battery cells to autonomous ride-hailing company Zoox in early 2026, offering superior energy density, safety and reliability.

headline: Panasonic's energy unit to supply auto batteries to Amazon's Zoox from 2026
summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Japan's Panasonic Energy will supply cylindrical ​batteries to Amazon's self-driving ‌unit Zoox starting from early 2026 under a multi-‌year agreement, the Panasonic Holdings unit said on Tuesday.  "Panasonic Energy will deliver its latest 2170 batteries beginning in early ⁠2026 to support ‌Zoox's growing robotaxi service and operations," the company ‍said in a statement.  The cells will initially come from Japan, with plans to expand to ​Panasonic Energy's Kansas plant, it ‌added.

content.title: Panasonic's energy unit to supply auto batteries to Amazon's Zoox from 2026
content.summary: TOKYO (Reuters) -Japan's Panasonic Energy will supply cylindrical ​batteries to Amazon's self-driving ‌unit Zoox starting from early 2026 under a multi-‌year agreement, the Panasonic Holdings unit said on Tuesday.  "Panasonic Energy will deliver its latest 2170 batteries beginning in early ⁠2026 to support ‌Zoox's growing robotaxi service and operations," the company ‍said in a statement.  The cells will initially come from Japan, with plans to expand to ​Panasonic Energy's Kansas plant, it ‌added.

headline: Alibaba’s AI Arm Surges 34% While China Commerce Bounces Back
summary: The company posted a 16% rise in Chinese e-commerce revenue for the period, suggesting it was faring well in a three-way battle with JD.com Inc. and Meituan.  The strong results are likely to encourage investors betting on Alibaba as a leader in artificial intelligence development.  The company has accelerated the release of AI models, culminating in the relaunch of its flagship Qwen mobile app — an effort to replicate the success of OpenAI’s ChatGPT that got off to a fast start this month.

content.title: Alibaba’s AI Arm Surges 34% While China Commerce Bounces Back
content.summary: The company posted a 16% rise in Chinese e-commerce revenue for the period, suggesting it was faring well in a three-way battle with JD.com Inc. and Meituan.  The strong results are likely to encourage investors betting on Alibaba as a leader in artificial intelligence development.  The company has accelerated the release of AI models, culminating in the relaunch of its flagship Qwen mobile app — an effort to replicate the success of OpenAI’s ChatGPT that got off to a fast start this month.

headline: Continua Brings Amazon, Google, Instagram, and TikTok Shopping to Social AI
summary: NEW YORK, November 25, 2025--Continua, the company pioneering Social AI, today announced the addition of Amazon, Google Shopping, Instagram, and TikTok to its artificial intelligence for group chats. Just in time for the holiday season, Continua users can now collaborate on family wish lists, teacher gifts, white elephant ideas, and more, all inside of existing group conversations. Users can also ask Continua to search for the lowest price on specific items.

content.title: Continua Brings Amazon, Google, Instagram, and TikTok Shopping to Social AI

Users can also ask Continua to search for the lowest price on specific items.
